p: To understand the existing environment of monitoring in the Circumpolar North, this review focused on programmes that were conducting, implementing or developing monitoring initiatives actively during Fall 2017 (September-December) and met the following criterion: (1) monitored environmental and/or human health indicators linked to climate change; (2) took place in and around Indigenous communities, and had some level of community involvement; (3) used some element of technology (eg mobile-phone, web-based technology, etc.); and (4) took place in the Circumpolar North.
